description: This app doesn't actually update the Crontab for you. It just helps you write the line that you need to paste into Crontab. It doesn't make Crontab enteries significantly safer. I would say its good for beginners, but honestly they could just look up how to do it properly in the same amount of time.
you can get similar information from https://crontab.guru/every-5-minutes

Though I am used to a command line I had need to schedule a large number of jobs.

Wondering if there was anything graphical that could help me to do this here I am.

This application is *wonderful* and the the description points out the features exactly.

It is really nice to not have to think about the crontab syntax too much.

The human readable form is a really nice touch and then being able to click Copy is fantastic.

Then, using:
$ crontab -e
from a command line I can then just paste the contents.

crontab -e
is all that should be used to edit a crontab.

It is not safe to edit any crontab directly and it is not intended for a crontab to be edited directly.

- *Thank you* to the developer.
summary: Excellent and does what it purports to do

description:
Works well. I do like the program but I cannot find it packed as anything else but a SNAP. I am always having problems with SNAPs. Issues that occur with Linux programs as SNAPs disappear when I install them in another packing format.

I would love to see it available as a decent usable package like a deb, appimage or a flatpack.
summary: They only thing that I dislike is that it is a SNAP
